title: No module named caffe2.python
body_html:
root@kylin-os:~# cd ~ && python -c 'from caffe2.python import core' 2>/dev/null && echo "Success" || echo "Failure"
Failure

root@kylin-os:~# python 
Python 2.7.11+ (default, Apr 25 2016, 14:00:43) 
[GCC 5.3.1 20160225] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from caffe2.python import core
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
ImportError: No module named caffe2.python

There are no problems with the previous steps.I found out according to the this info tutorial that I lack a lot of components，

/usr/local/                                   
  +-- bin/
    +-- python (can't find)
    +-- <other executables>
  +-- include/
    +-- <header files for c and c++ libraries>
  +-- lib/
    +-- libcaffe2.dylib （can't find)
    +-- <other Caffe2 c and c++ libraries>
    +-- <other c and c++ libraries>
    +-- python2.7/                              
      +-- site-packages/
        +-- caffe2/      (can't find)                     
        +-- <other installed python modules>

The path to Caffe2 is /home/kylin1/Desktop/pytorch
The path to python2.7.exe is /usr/bin
The path to libcaffe2.dylib is can't find in system

Details

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch

  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source

  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):cmake ..

  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS

  • PyTorch version: 0.5.0a0+c446269

  • Python version: 2.7

  • CUDA/cuDNN version: none

  • GPU models and configuration: none

  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.3.1

  • CMake version: 3.5.1

body:
```
root@kylin-os:~# cd ~ && python -c 'from caffe2.python import core' 2>/dev/null && echo "Success" || echo "Failure"
Failure
```
```
root@kylin-os:~# python 
Python 2.7.11+ (default, Apr 25 2016, 14:00:43) 
[GCC 5.3.1 20160225] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from caffe2.python import core
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
ImportError: No module named caffe2.python

```
There are no problems with the previous steps.I found out according to the  [ this info ](https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-do-i-get-import-errors-in-python-when-i-try-to-use-caffe2) tutorial that I lack a lot of components，
```
/usr/local/                                   
  +-- bin/
    +-- python (can't find)
    +-- <other executables>
  +-- include/
    +-- <header files for c and c++ libraries>
  +-- lib/
    +-- libcaffe2.dylib （can't find)
    +-- <other Caffe2 c and c++ libraries>
    +-- <other c and c++ libraries>
    +-- python2.7/                              
      +-- site-packages/
        +-- caffe2/      (can't find)                     
        +-- <other installed python modules>
```
The path to Caffe2 is /home/kylin1/Desktop/pytorch
The path to python2.7.exe is /usr/bin
The path to libcaffe2.dylib is can't find in system

# Details

-     PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
- 
-     How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
- 
-     Build command you used (if compiling from source):cmake ..
- 
-     OS: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
- 
-     PyTorch version: 0.5.0a0+c446269
- 
-     Python version: 2.7
- 
-     CUDA/cuDNN version: none
- 
-     GPU models and configuration: none
- 
-     GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.3.1
- 
-     CMake version: 3.5.1
